title: Several National League games postponed after fatality on rail line disrupts travel
text:
Bromley's match at Solihull Moors will kick off at 3.15pm after delayed departure

A fatality on rail line near Milton Keynes has affected travel out of London Euston

Several of Saturday's Vanarama National League games have been postponed after a fatality on the rail line near Milton Keynes affected departures from London Euston station.

Sutton, Dagenham & Redbridge and Dover were all prevented from travelling to their away games at AFC Fylde, Stockport and Barrow respectively as services heading for the north-west were badly affected.

Fylde and Dagenham both announced their postponements on Twitter shortly after 12pm, with Stockport clarifying that the latter game was off due to 'a major incident in the Milton Keynes area, affecting departures at London Euston station'.

National League games have been called off after fatality disrupted London Euston departures

Barrow then tweeted shortly before 2pm that their game was off due to 'extremely frustrating circumstances', with opponents Dover earlier having reported that their journey had been delayed.

The disruption also affected some London-based rugby league fans travelling to Super League's Grand Final at Old Trafford, and service operator Virgin Trains responded to one frustrated St Helens fan on Twitter that 'there was a fatality on the line which caused the delays'.

Bromley's departure from Euston was also held up but they eventually arrived for their game at Solihull Moors, though kick-off was delayed by 15 minutes to 3.15.
description: Sutton, Dagenham & Redbridge and Dover were all prevented from travelling to their away games at AFC Fylde, Stockport and Barrow as services heading north-west were badly affected.
